item.title: R to @soopiya: Oh definitely - he’s been feeling that way a long time and has dedicated his life to an extent to making amends.

item.title:
RT by @jonronson: The American anti-abortion movement is celebrating a huge victory. The origin of the movement is surprising. @JonRonson has the story.
https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/m0011cpq
item.dc:creator: @BBCRadio4

item.title: R to @seagullsmitch: My keyboard skills never stretched to it! I don't think I included that part in the interview. I just remember him telling me that he felt his style really began with that song.
item.dc:creator: @jonronson
item.description: My keyboard skills never stretched to it! I don't think I included that part in the interview. I just remember him telling me that he felt his style really began with that song.

item.title: Thank you very much to the @BostonGlobe for making Things Fell Apart one of their podcasts of the summer! They think children should listen too, which I agree with, especially because unusually for me there's no swearing. CC @sarah_shebbeare

item.title: Had a great time at >@writingandideas at @borrishouse. It’s a lovely festival in the grounds of a castle near Dublin. My fellow speakers included Laurie Anderson, Ruth Wilson, Sarah Waters and, as you can see, Colin Greenwood and Nick Broomfield. https://www.instagram.com/p/CevYidVO1Yq/?igshid=MDJmNzVkMjY=
item.dc:creator: @jonronson
item.description: Had a great time at @writingandideas at @borrishouse. It’s a lovely festival in the grounds of a castle near Dublin. My fellow speakers included Laurie Anderson, Ruth Wilson, Sarah Waters and, as you can see, Colin Greenwood and Nick Broomfield. instagram.com/p/CevYidVO1Yq/…
